Content: Executive function
Financial habits and norms
Financial knowledge and decision-making skills
The thinking skills and abilities needed to plan ahead, focus attention, remember information, practice self-control, and juggle multiple tasks.
The values, standards, routine practices, and rules to live by used to navigate day-to-day financial life.
The knowledge and skills needed to understand the financial world and make informed financial decisions.
You’re starting out! This means that you’re beginning to learn the important money skills and behaviors you’ll need now and in the future.

You’re well on your way! This means you use many types of skills and behaviors that help you manage your money. But remember that we can always continue to improve.
